verse: तदभ्यद्रवत्तमभ्यवदत् कोऽसीति वायुर्वा अहमस्मीत्यब्रवीन्मातरिश्वा वा अहमस्मीति ॥

terms.मातरिश्वा वा अहमस्मीति: Or, I am Matariśvan (the Fire god)"

shankarachary-comm.meaning: He ran to That. That said: “who art thou”? lie replied: “I am Vayu or Matarisva.
shankarachary-comm.comm: Vayu [ Air ] is so named from the root which means ‘to go’or ‘to smell.’ Vayu is also called ‘Matarisva’ because it travels [ svayati ] in space [ matari ]

meaning: Meaning: The context of these verses is not clear from the given lines. However, it appears to be a conversation where one person asks another person for their identity. The person being asked responds by stating that they are either Vayu (the Wind) or Matariśvan (the Fire god).
